data.title: ddd
data.text:
PRE-PRODUCTION

Las Vidas De Celia

(Oberon Cinematografia, TAU [Mex], Altavista [Mex]) A woman trying to makesense of her life finds her own unsuccessful suicide attempt interweaves withthe investigation of a young girl's murder on the same night. Dir: AntonioChavarrias. Main cast: Najwa Nimri, Luis Tosar, Daniel Gimenez Castro, AlexCasanovas, Aida Folch, Jimena Ayala. Shooting from July. Spanish.

Contact: Oberon, (34) 93 451 2560

Pan's Labyrinth (ElLaberinto Del Fauno)

(OMM, Estudios Picasso) Int'l sales: Wild Bunch. Dist (Sp/Lat Am): Warner BrosPictures International. A horror story told through a young boy's perspectiveduring the Spanish Civil War. Exec prod: Alvaro Augustin. Prods: AlfonsoCuaron, Guillermo del Toro, Frida Torresblanco, Bertha Navarrao. Dir/scr:Guillermo del Toro. Main cast: Sergi Lopez, Maribel Verdu, Ariadna Gil, AlexAngulo. Shooting from July in Spain. Spanish.

Contact: Wild Bunch (33) 1 53 01 50 20

Teresa

(Lolafilms, Artemis [Fr], Future Film Group [UK]) A fanciful take on the lifeof Spain's 16th-century Saint Teresa. Exec prod: Andres VicenteGomez. Dir/scr: Ray Loriga. Main cast: Viggo Mortensen, Paz Vega, VictoriaAbril, Leonor Watling. Shooting from October in Spain.

Contact: Lolafilms, (34) 91 436 7400

Uno De Los Dos No PuedeEstar Equivocado

(La Cicatriz) A fantastical comedy about the devil coming to Madrid to rekindlehis love affair with a TV journalist he met during the war in Lebanon. Dir/scr:Pablo Llorca. Main cast: Leonor Watling, Luis Miguel Cintra, Alberto Jimenez.Shooting from July for 10 weeks in Madrid and Beirut. Spanish.

Contact: La Cicatriz, (34)91 594 0030

Volver

(El Deseo) Int'l sales: Focus International. Budget: Euros 9m. Dark comedyabout three generations of women getting by in a working-class neighbourhood.Exec prod: Agustin Almodovar. Dir/scr: Pedro Almodovar. DoP: Jose Luis Alcaine.Music: Alberto Iglesias. Ed: Pepe Salcedo. Main cast: Penelope Cruz, CarmenMaura, Lola Duenas, Blanca Portillo, Chus Lampreave. Shooting from July 18 inMadrid and Castilla La Mancha. Spanish.

Contact: El Deseo, (34) 91 724 8199

IN PRODUCTION

Alatriste

(Estudios Picasso, Origen PC, Universal Studios) Budget: Euros 20m. Int'lsales: TF1 International. The tales of a 17th-century adventurer andhis sidekick. Dir/scr: Agustin Diaz Yanes, based on the novel by Arturo PerezReverte. Main cast: Viggo Mortensen, Eduardo Noriega, Javier Camara, ElenaAnaya and Ariadna Gil Shooting from March 7 in Cadiz, Madrid and Seville.Spanish.

Contact: Telecinco, (34) 91 396 6902

Cyrano Fernandez

(Indigomedia, Cinema Sur [Ven]) Based loosely on Cyrano de Bergerac,this modern-day love triangle is set against a tough inner-city neighbourhood.Exec prod: Carlos Lizarralde. Dir/scr: Alberto Arvelo. Art dir: Matias Tikas.DoP: Cezary Jaworski. Ed: Jose Ares. Music: Mario de Benito. Make-up and Hair:Stella Jacob, Tatiana Rodriguez. Wardrobe: Solange Arvelo, Maritza Zambrano,Aleiram Pinango. SFX: Daneil Souto. Main cast: Edgar Ramirez, Ximo Solano,Pastor Oviedo, Yessica Grau. Shooting from April 11 for 11 weeks in Venezuelaand New York. Spanish.

Contact: Indigomedia, (34) 96 352 6558

Dark Blue Almost Black (AzulOscuro Casi Negro)

(Tesela) Budget: Euros 1.95m. A young university graduate forced into hisfather's doorman job dreams of a better life. Exec prod: Jose Antonio Felez.Dir/scr: Daniel Sanchez Arevalo. Art dir : Federico Gracia Cambero. DoP: JuanCarlos Gomez. Ed: Nacho Ruiz Capillas. Music: Pascul Gaine. Make-up: KarmeleSoler. Hair: Francisco Rodriguez. Wardrobe: Nereida Bonmati. Main cast: QuimGutierrez, Marta Etura, Antonio de la Torre, Raul Arevalo, Hector Colome, EvaPallares. Shooting from May 30 for 8 weeks. Spanish.

Contact: Tesela, (34) 91 367 6776

De Profundis

(Continental Producciones, Desembarco Producciones) Animated feature set tomusic about a painter in love with the ocean. Exec prod: Chelo Loureiro.Dir/scr: Miguel Anxo Prado. Art dir: Miguel Anxo Prado. Shooting for 15 monthsin 2005.

Contact: Continental Producciones, (34) 91 474 5415

Desde Que Amanece Apetece

(Enrique Cerezo PC) A good-for-nothing young man is sent to learn the businessof his uncle, who turns out to be a two-bit hustler of lame show-boys. Execprod: Enrique Cerezo. Dir: Antonio del Real. Scr: Joaquin Andujar. Art dir:Carlos Bodelon. DoP: Hans Burmann. Ed: Miguel Angel Santamaria. Make-up: MariaAmaro. Wardrobe: Mar Bardavio. SFX: Fx. Main cast: Gabino Diego, ArturoFernandez, Loles Leon. Shooting from May 23 for 8 weeks in Madrid. Spanish.

Contact: Enrique Cerezo PC, (34) 91 512 0058

The Distance (La Distancia)

(Abaco Movies) A down-and-out boxer is lured into a murder plot. Dir/scr: InakiDorronsoro. Main cast: Jose Coronado, Federico Luppi, Miguel Angel Silvestre,Belen Lopez. Shooting from June 27 in Madrid and Palencia.

Contact: Abaco Movies, (34) 91 458 3869

Family Law (Derecho DeFamilia)

(Wanda Films, BD Cine [Arg], Classic Film [It], Paradis [Fr]) Dist (Sp):Nirvana Films. Budget: $1m. Comedy about a man who must come to terms with hisown identity after the death of his father. Dir/scr: Daniel Burman. Main cast:Daniel Hendler, Julieta Diaz, Adriana Aizemberg, Arturo Goetz, Eloy Burman,Damian Dreizik. Shooting from May 9 for nine weeks in Buenos Aires. Spanish.

Contact: Wanda Films, (34) 91 352 8376

Hotel Tivoli

(Filmanova, Zentropa [Den], Animatografo 2 [Port], Aquafilms [Arg]) Int'lsales: Trust Film Sales. A lighter changing hands introduces us to an ensemblecast of international characters, all of whom are dealing with relationships.Exec prod: Anton Reixa. Dir: Anton Reixa. Scr: Anton Reixa, Xose Morais, CarlosPortela. Art dir: Alexandra Fernandez. DoP: Marcelo Iaccarino. Ed: GuillermoRepresa. Music: Lucio Godoy. Make-up: Almudena Fonseca. Hair: Elena Perez.Wardrobe: Lola Dapena. SFX: Antonio Segade. Main cast: Luis Tosar, Gines GarciaMillan, JA Egido, Isidoro Fernandez, Nancho Novo. Shooting from May 23 for 9weeks in Spain, Denmark, Greenland, Portugal and Argentina.

Contact: MPC Asociados, (34) 91 431 4257

The Kovak Box

(Filmax, Estudios Picasso) Int'l sales: Filmax International. A science fictionwriter travels to the Balearic Islands to give a conference, only to findhimself wrapped up in an evil mystery of people committing suicide. Dir: DanielMonzon. Scr: Daniel Monzon, Jorge Guerricaechevarria. Prod dir: Teresa Gefaell,Carla Albeniz. Art dir: Anton Laguna. DoP: Carles Gusi. Ed: Simon. Make-up:Pepe Quetglas. Hair: Blanca Sanchez. Wardrobe: Eva Arretse. Main cast: TimothyHutton, Lucia Jimenez, David Kelly, Gary Piquer. Shooting from April 11 for 11weeks. English.

Contact: Filmax, (34) 93 336 8555

Los Aires Dificiles

(Tornasol Films, Continental Producciones, Maestranza Films) A middle-aged manmust face his own past and family secrets when he moves to a coastal town. Execprod: Mariela Besuievsky. Dir: Gerardo Herrero. Scr: Angeles Gonzalez-Sinde,Alberto Macias. Art dir: Jose Dominguez del Olmo. DoP: Alfredo Mayo. Ed: CarmenFrias. Music: Lucio Godoy. Make-up: Paca Almenara. Hair: Alicia Lopez.Wardrobe: Paco Delgado. Main cast: Jose Luis Garcia Perez, Cuca Escribano, RobertoEnriquez, Alberto Jimenez, Carmen Elias. Shooting from June 6 for 8 weeks inMadrid and Cadiz. Spanish.

Contact: Tornasol Films, (34) 91 102 3024

Rolling (Rodando)

(Wanda Vision, Indigomedia, Fenix PC) Budget: Euros 2.1m. A very specialbicycle passed from individual to individual links several tales. Exec prod:Jose Maria Morales, Emilio Oviedo, Francisco Lazaro. Dir: Sigfrid Monleon. Scr:Martin Roman, Sigfrid Monleon. Art dir: Rafael Jannone. DoP: Alfonso Parra. Ed:Angel Armada. Make-up: Esther Guillem. Hair: Ana Guillem. Wardrobe: InesLiberato. SFX: Miguel Olarrieta. Main cast: Sancho Gracia, Pilar Bardem,Barbara Lennie, Javier PEreira, Alberto Ferreiro, Carlos Bardem. Shooting fromMay 16 for 7 weeks in Valencia. Spanish.

Contact: Wanda Vision, (34) 91 351 7283

Salvador Puig Antich(Provisional Title)

(MediaPro) Budget: Euros 6m. The last two years in the life of a politicalmartyr put to death at the age of 25 in a Barcelona prison at the tail end ofthe Franco era following years on the lam with a group of anarchists. Execprod: Jaume Roures. Dir: Manuel Huerga. Scr: Manuel Huerga, Lluis Arcarazo,based on novel Compte Enrere by Francesc Escribano. Main cast: Daniel Bruehl.Shooting summer 2005 in Barcelona, Valencia and France. Spanish/Catalan.

Contact: MediaPro, (34) 93 476 1551

The White Knight

(DeA Planeta, Carolina Films, Future Films [UK]) Medieval adventure tale. Int'lsales: Arclight Films. Budget: Euros 13.6m. Dir/scr: Vicente Aranda, based onthe 15th century knight's tale Tirant Lo Blanc. Main cast: Victoria Abril, PazVega, Pilar Lopez de Ayala, Leonardo Sbaraglia, Caspar Zafer. Shooting fromMarch 28 to end June. English.

Contact: DeA Planeta, (34) 91 768 0309

POST-PRODUCTION

Algo Habran Hecho

(Ibarretxe & Co, Dale Candela (Arg), OM Films (Fr)) Based on the true storyof a nun who was kidnapped and went missing in Buenos Aires in 1977. Prods:Eduardo Carneros, Maria Cabrejas, Olivier de Bannes. Ed: Luis CesarD'Angiolillo. Music: Pablo Velez. Dir: Fernando Oscar Nogueira. Scr: Maria Cabrejas.Main cast: Jeanne Balibar, Itziar Lazkano, Dario Grandinetti, Pablo Echarry,Valentina Bassi. Shot from Dec 2004 in Argentina.

Contact: Ibarretxe & Co, (34) 94 479 2120

The Aura (El Aura)

(Tornasol Films, Patagonik Film Group [Arg], Davis Films [Fr]) Int'l sales:Celluloid. Psychological thriller about a taxidermist whose fantasies about howto commit the perfect crime become reality. Dir/scr: Fabian Bielinsky. Maincast: Ricardo Darin, Dolores Fonzi, Pablo Cedro, Jorge D'Elia, Alejandro Awada.Shot from Oct 19 2004 in Argentina. Spanish.

Contact: Tornasol Films, (34) 91 542 9564

Birth Of A Passion: TheOrigins Of Football (El Nacimiento De Una Pasion: Los Origenes Del Futbol)

(Wanda Films, Transglobe Pictures) Documentary. A sweeping look at hundreds ofyears of the sport of football. Dir: Jesus Sanchez. Scr: Jesus Sanchez,Fernando Gonzalez. Exec prod: Jose Maria Morales, Javier Linares. Prods: JorgeLinares, Miguel Morales. DoP: Juan Carlos Gomez. Ed: Laura Casamayor delRincon. Distr (Sp): Wanda Vision. Shot for 74 weeks from June 6 2003 in Spain,UK, France, Italy, China, Japan and Mexico. Spanish.

Contact: Wanda Films, (34)91 352 8376

Camaron

(Filmanova Invest, Monoria Films) Dist (Sp): Buena Vista. Biopic of flamencostar Camaron de la Isla. Dir: Jaime Chavarri. Scr: Chavarri, Alvaro del Amo.Main cast: Oscar Jaenada, Veronica Sanchez, Merce Llorens. Shot from Feb 282005 in Madrid, Cadiz and Paris.

Contact: Filmanova, (34) 91 548 8636

Cargo

(Morena Films, Slate Films [UK], Oberon Cinematografica, Vaca Films, Hepp Films[Swe]) Int'l sales: Wild Bunch. Dist (Sp): DeA Planeta. Thriller set on a cargoship where a stowaway finds himself involved in a deadly mystery. Exec prods:Juan Gordon, Andrea Calderwood. Dir: Clive Gordon. Scr: Paul Laverty. Art dir:Jordi Yrla. DoP: Sean Bobbit. Ed: Fernando Franco. Music: Sergio Moure, StephenWarbeck. Make-up: Alma Casal. Wardrobe: Bina Daigeler. SFX: SanDimas-Barcelona. Main cast: Daniel Bruehl, Paul Mullan, Luis Tosar, Nicki AmukaBird, Carlos Blanco, Gonzalo Cunill, Pere Eugeni Font, Gary Lewis. Shot fromFeb 28 2005 for 7 weeks in Barcelona and Ghana. English.

Contact: Wild Bunch (33) 1 53 01 50 20

Donkey Jote

(Filmax Animation, Lumiq [It]) Budget: Euros 10m. Animated feature playing offclassic tale of Don Quixote. Exec prod: Carlos Fernandez. Dir: Josep Pozo. Scr:Angel Pariente. Art dir: Esteban Martin. Ed: Felix Bueno. Music: Oscar Araujo.Shot from Jan 7, 2005 to Sept 9, 2006.

Contact: Filmax, (34) 93 3368555

El Taxista Ful

(ZIP Films) Budget: Euros 512,000. A middle-aged man steals taxis in order towork as a taxi driver, but he is continually arrested. Exec prods: Jordi Rediu,Norbert Llaras. Dir/scr: Jo Sol. Art dir: Afra Rigamonti. Ed : Sergi Diez.Music: Lhasa, 99 posse. Main cast: Pepe Rovira, Marc Sampere, Santiago LopezPetit, Marina Garces. Shot from March 7 2005 for 5 weeks in Barcelona.

Contact: ZIP Films, (34) 93441 0733

Elsa & Fred

(Tesela, Shazan [Arg]) Budget: Euros 1.8m. A sentimental comedy about an olderwoman who helps bring joy and vitality back into the life of her recentlywidowed new neighbor. Exec prod: Jose Antonio Felez. Dir: Marcos Carnevale.Scr: Marcos Carnevale, Lily Ann Martin, Marcela Guerty. Art dir: SaturIdarreta. DoP: Juan Carlos Gomez. Ed: Nacho Ruiz Capillas. Music: Lilo Vitale.Make-up: Karmele Soler. Hair: Francisco Rodriguez. Wardrobe: Nereida Bonmati.SFX: Kinema. Main cast: Manuel Alexandre, China Zorrilla, Blanca Portillo, JoseAngel Egido, Omar Munoz. Shot from Feb 22 2005 for 8 weeks in Madrid, Rome andBuenos Aires. Spanish.

Contact: Tesela, (34) 91 367 6776

The Feast Of The Goat (LaFiesta Del Chivo)

(Lolafilms, Future Films [UK]) Drama. Budget: Euros 8m. A woman returns to theDominican Republic of her youth and must confront her family, including her agedfather who was once a right-hand man to the dictator Trujillo. Prod: AndresVicente Gomez. Exec prods: Guy Collins, Michael Ryan. Assoc prods: Jose ManuelGarasino, Albert Martinez-Martin. Dir: Luis Llosa. Scr: Llosa, Augusto Cabada,based on the novel by Mario Vargas Llosa. DoP: Javier Salmones. Art dir:Salvador Parra. Main cast: Tomas Milian, Isabella Rossellini, Paul Freeman,Juan Diego Botto, Stephanie Leonidas, Eileen Atkins, Steven Bauer. Shot for 10weeks from Oct 11 2005 in Santo Domingo and Madrid.

Contact: Lolafilms, (34) 91 436 7400

Fragile

(Filmax, Just Films) Terror. A nurse fights to keep safe the young patients ofan isolated and seemingly haunted children's hospital. Exec prods: JulioFernandez, Joan Ginard. Dir: Jaume Balaguero. Scr: Balaguero, Jordi Galceran.DoP: Xavi Gimenez. Art dir: Alain Bainee. Main cast: Calista Flockhart, ElenaAnaya, Richard Roxburgh, Gemma Jones, Colin McFarlane and Michael Pennington.Shot for 9 weeks from Aug 30 2004 in Barcelona and the Isle of Wight. English.

Contact: Filmax, (34) 93 263 2222

The Gronholm Conspiracy (ElMetodo Gronholm)

(Alquimia Cinema) Int'l sales: Latido Films. Drama set against the world ofmultinational executive recruiting. Prod: Francisco Ramos. Dir: MarceloFigueras. Scr: Marcelo Figueras and Mateo Gil, baesd on the stageplay by JordiGalceran. Main cast: Eduardo Noriega, Najwa Nimri, Eduard Fernandez, ErnestoAlterio, Carmelo Gomez, Adriana Ozores, Natalia Verbeke, Pablo Echarri. Shotfrom Nov 8 2004 for 6 weeks in Madrid.

Contact: Alquimia Cinema, (34) 91 748 9040

Honest People (GenteHonrada)

(Mate Production, DMVB [Fr]) Budget: E 4m. A man travels to Colombia to adopt achild for his employer but changes his mind when he meets a woman during histrip. Exec prods: Mate Cantero, Thierry Forte. Dir/scr: Bob Decout. Art dir:Sylvie Delesmontey. DoP: Chiqui Palma. Music: Dominique Fournier. Make-up: AnaLozano. Hair: Jacqueline Mayorga. Wardrobe: Isabel Merida. Main cast: VictoriaAbril, Annie Girardot. Shot for 7 weeks from Jan 9 2005 in Paris and Bogota.French.

Contact: Mate Production, (34) 91 395 2254

Honor De Cavalleria

(Andergraun Films, Notro Films) Dist (Sp): Notro Films. Budget: Euros 360,000.Free-spirited adaptation of Don Quixote. Dir/scr: Albert Serra. Exec prods:Albert Serra, Montse Triola. Art dir: Jimmy Gimferrer. DoP: ChristopheFarnarier. Ed: David Gallart. Music: Ferran Font, Cristian Vogel. Wardrobe:Jimmy Gimferrer. Main cast: Lluis Carbo, Lluis Serrat. Shot summer 2004 andspring 2005. Catalan.

Contact: MP Comunicacion & PR, (34) 93 896 4611

Iberia

(Morena Films) Int'l sales: Wild Bunch. A fusion of traditional and modernSpanish music and dance starring such artists as Sara Baras and AntonioCanales. Dir/scr: Carlos Saura. Main cast: Rosa Torres-Pardo, Manolo Sanlúcar,Gerardo Núñez, Sara Baras, Aida Gomez, Jose Antonio Ruiz, Chano Dominguez,Antonio Canales, Enrique y Estrella Morente, Jose Antonio Rodriguez, MiguelAngel Berna, Patrick de Bana y Jose Segovia.

Contact: Wild Bunch (33) 1 53 01 50 20

Intimos Desconocidos

(Pape Perez PC) Budget: Euros 6,000. Blind dates set up in internet chat roomshave different results for a group of people. Dir: Pape Perez. Scr: MarisaLuengo. Art dir: Estrella Coral. DoP: Guillermo Jauregui. Ed: Jorge Carrasco.Mus: Luis Agius, Borja Bueno, Genesis Candela, Adri Piurca, Ignacio Celma.Hair/make-up: Raquel Lopez, Arancha Fernandez. Wardrobe: Estrella Coral. Maincast: Cristina Soria, Non Villar, Tony Brocal, Paula Bass, Jose Garretas,Fernando Campo. Shooting for 5 weeks from Feb 2005 in Madrid.

Contact: Pape Perez PC, (34) 685 421 576

Kilometro 31

(Lemon Films [Mex], Videocine [Mex], Castelao Productions) Dist (Sp): Sogedasa.A woman is able to communicate with her dead twin. Dir/scr: RigobertoCastaneda. Art dir: Bernardo Trujillo. DoP: Alejandro Martinez. Ed: Alberto deToro. Make-up/Hair: Gabriela Benito. Wardrobe: Mariestela Fernandez. SFX:Alejandro Vazquez. Main cast: Iliana Fox, Adria Collado, Raul Mendez, MikelMateos. Shot from Jan 31 2005 for 7.5 weeks in Mexico. Spanish.

Contact: Filmax, (34) 93 336 8558

Las Chicas Andan Sueltas

(Enrique Cerezo) Five young women living on the outskirts of Madrid will dowhatever it takes to get ahead and out of the hood. Dir: Juan Vicente Cordoba.Scr: Cordoba, Maria Reyes Arias. DoP: Teo Delgado. Art dir: Vicente Mateu.Sound: Antonio Camarasa. Ed: Pablo Blanco. Main cast: Natalia Verbeke, JuanaAcosta, Zay Nuba, Maria Vazquez, Marian Alvarez, Daniel Guzman, AndresGertrudix, Alfredo Villa. Shot for 8 weeks from Aug 23 2004 in Madird. Spanish.

Contact: Enrique Cerezo, (34) 91 512 0058

The Last Wound (La UltimaHerida)

(Cre-Accion Films, Zeppelins PC) Dist: Lauren Films. Budget: E 640,000.Documentary. A look at people who lost their parents as children of the SpanishCivil War and are now mending the past by searching for their loved ones indiscovered common graves. Exec prod: Rodolfo Montero de Palacio. Dir/scr:Israel Sanchez-Prieto. DoP: Alberto Molina. Ed: Cristina Otero. Music: Mario deBenito. Shot for 14 weeks during 6-7 months around Spain. Spanish.

Contact: Cre-Accion Films, (34) 91 457 6146

Life And Color (Vida YColor)

(Imval Producciones, Bausan Films) Dist (Sp): Alta Classics. A boy with a vividimagination comes of age in a Madrid barrio during the last days of Franco'slife. Exec prods: Luis Angel Ramirez, Loris Omedes. Dir/scr: SantiagoTabernero. Art dir: Soledad Sesena. DoP: Jose Luis Alcaine. Ed: Pepe Salcedo.Mus: The Matthew Herbert Big Bang. Make-up: Maria Dolores Osuna. Hair: AnaRenedo. Wardrobe: Pepe Reyes. Main cast: Junio Valverde, Silvia Abascal, AnaWagener, Adolfo Fernandez, Joan Dalmau. Shot for 8 weeks from Oct 18 2004 inMadrid. Spanish.

Contact: Imval Producciones, (34) 91 361 3993

Love In Self Defense (AmorEn Defensa Propia)

(MediaPro, Universal Studios) Budget: Euros 1.95m. Romantic comedy about twopeople whose lives are about to change dramatically when they meet. Exec prod:Javier Mendez. Dir/scr: Rafa Russo. Art dirs: Monica Bernuy, Dolo Company. DoP:Daniel Aranyo. Ed: Fernando Guarinelo. Mus: Lucio Godoy. Make-up: Concha Marti.Hair: Mara Collazo. Main cast: Ana Fernandez, Gustavo Garzon, Andres Gertrudix.Shot from Sept 20 2004 for 7 weeks in Barcelona, Tarragona and Buenos Aires.Spanish.

Contact: MediaPro, (34) 93 476 1551

The Man Who Came To A Village(El Hombre Que Llego A Un Pueblo)

(ABC Production-Barcelona, Axiom Film [UK], Capablanca Film [Arg]). Budget: E3.5m. A second-rate drug trafficker poses as a priest in a small village and,realizing the locals mistake him as a real priest, must decide whether to begina whole new life under this new identity. Exec prods: Robert Duvall, Eva Baro,Toni Sole. Dir/scr: Miguel Pereira, based on the novel of the same name byHector Tizon. DoP: Xavier Gimenez. Main cast: Leonardo Sbaraglia, Maria Botto,Claudia Coulter, Robert Duvall, Luciana Pedraza. Shot for 8 weeks from Sept 152004 in Argentina. Spanish.

Contact: ABS Production Barcelona, (34) 93 487 8436

Malas Temporadas

(Iberrota Films) Budget: Euros 2.4m. Dist (Sp): Golem. Tale about immigration,second opportunities and hope turns on the lives of three characters - Carlos,Ana and Mikel. Exec prod: Fernando Victoria de Lecea. Dir: Manuel MartinCuenca. Scr: Alejandro Hernandez. Art dir: Victor Molero. DoP: David Carretero.Ed: Angel Hernandez-Zoido. Make-up: Patricia Lopez. Hair: Mara Collazo.Wardrobe: Josune Lasa. SFX: Molina. Main cast: Javier Camara, Eman Ona,Nathalie Poza, Leonor Watling, Pere Arquillue. Shot from Mar 2 2005 for 7weeks. Spanish.

Contact: Iberrota Films,(34) 91 541 5768

Maradona

(Pentagrama Films, Estudios Picasso, Exception Wild Bunch [Fr], Fidelite [Fr])Int'l sales: Exception Wild Bunch. Budget: Euros 1.2m. Documentary about thelife of Argentinean football legend Diego Maradona. Exec prod: Jose Ibanez.Dir/scr: Emir Kusturica. DoP: Sebastian Arguello, Rodrigo Pulpeiro, MarceloLorenzutti. Ed: Mica Svetolik. Cast: Diego Maradona. Shot from April 30 2005for 6 weeks.

Contact: Wild Bunch (33) 1 53 01 50 20

Melissa P

(Bess Movie [It], Pentagrama Films) Dist (Sp): Columbia Pictures. Based on thehit novel about a young girl's sexual encounters. Exec prod: Roberto Manni.Dir: Luca Guadagnino. Scr: Luca Guadagnino, Barbara Alberti, Cristina Farina.Art dir: Gianni Silvestri. DoP: Mario Armurra. Ed: Walter Fasano. Music: LucioGodoy. Make-up: Fernanda Perez. Hair: Giogio Gregorini. Wardrobe: AntonellaCannarozzi. Main cast: Maria Valverde, Nilo Mur, Letizia Ciampa, PrimoReggiani, Fabrizia Sacchi, Geraldine Chaplin. Shot from March 7 2005 for 7weeks in Italy. Italian.

Contact: Pentagrama Films, (34) 91 429 9106

Next Week, Without Fail (LaSemana Que Viene, Sin Falta) (working title)

(Maestranza Films, S2Internacional, Linea Sur) Remake of the 1999 French filmMa Petite Enterprise, a social comedy about a man whose family business goes upin flames and is left without insurance and creditors breathing down his neck.Exec prod: Antonio Perez. Dir: Josetxo Sanmateo. Scr: Javier Munoz. Art dir:Sonia Nolla. DoP: Tote Trenas. Ed: Pepe Salcedo. Make-up: Carla Orete.Wardrobe: Fernando Garcia. SFX: Reyes Abades. Main cast: Imanol Arias, RobertoSanmartin, Charly Levi, Barbara de Lema, Josu Ormaetxe. Shot from April 4 2005for 6 weeks. Spanish.

Contact: Maestranza Films, (34) 95 421 0617

North- Between Infinity AndThe Void (El Norte- Entre El Infinito Y La Nada)

(CMP) Four Cuban immigrants in Spain try to carve a life for themselves byopening a dance and percussion studio. Exec prod: Francisco Alvarez. Dir: LinoVarela. DoP: Alberto Marroquin. Ed: Amado Lopez. Main cast: Yannara Arredondo,Otto Garcia Vinent, Antonio Mourdoch, Ariel Fonte, David Rodriguez. Shot fromMarch 2 2005 for 8 weeks. Spanish.

Contact: CMP, (34) 667 911088

Obaba

(Oria Films, Neue Impuls Film, Pandora Film) Dist (Sp): Alta Classics. Variousindividuals recollect through flashbacks their encounters with loneliness,violence and ethnic identity. Exec prod: Puy Oria. Dir/scr: Montxo Armendariz,based on the novel Obabakoak by Bernardo Atxaga. Art dir: Julio Estebean. DoP:Javier Aguirresarobe. Ed; Rori Sainz de Rozas. Hair: Fermin Galan. Main cast:Juan Diego Botto, Pilar Lopez de Ayala, Mercedes Sampietro, Eduard Fernandez.Shot from Sept 13 to end of November 2004. Spanish.

Contact: Oria Films, (34) 91 540 1157

Oculto

(Zebra Producciones, Iconica, Sintra Films [It], Future Films [UK]) Budget:Euros 3.4m. Dist (Sp): Warner. Psychological thriller about a man in a lovetriangle with two women where nothing is as it appears. Exec prods: AntonioSaura, Jose Nolla. Dir: Antonio Hernandez. Scr: Hernandez, Enrique Braso. Artdir: Gabriel Carrascal. DoP: Unax Mendia. Ed: Javier Laffaille. Make-up: RomanaGonzalez. Hair: Josefa Morales. Wardrobe: Cristina Caspuenas. Special effects:Reyes Abades. Main cast: Laia Marull, Angie Cepeda, Leonardo Sbaraglia. Shotfor 9 weeks from July 26 2004. Spanish.

Contact: Zebra Producciones, (34) 91 383 4025

Other Days Will Come (OtrosDias Vendran)

(Enrique Cerezo, Didac Films) Drama about a schoolteacher who falls in lovewith a 15 year-old student. Dir: Eduard Cortes. Scr: Cortes, Piti Espanol. DoP:Jose Luis Alcaine. Art dir: Carlos Zaragoza. Ed: Nacho Ruiz Capillas. Maincast: Cecilia Roth, Antonio Resines, Nadia de Santiago y Nacho Aldeguer. Shotfrom June 7 2004 in Madrid. Spanish.

Contact: Enrique Cerezo, (34) 91 512 0058

Residencial Caribe

(Directo de Informacion y Divulgacion, Casen Producciones, ICAIC [Cu]) Comedyturning on Cuban and Spanish family members fighting for rights to aninheritance, highlighting differences between the two cultures. Dir: AngelPelaez. Scr: Hector Quintero. DoP: Tote Trenas. Art dir: Eduardo SanchezTorelli. Ed: Miguel A Santamaria. Music: Milladoiro, Miguel Nunez. Main cast:Pepe Sancho, Jordi Vilches, Broselianda Hernandez. Shooting from Sept 2 to Oct13 2004 in Havana and Galicia. Spanish.
